It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. The team is behind Abacus rapid settlement network and provides APIs, settlement and clearing, accounting, compliance, fiat gateways, payments rails and open finance infrastructure for the industry.

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.

profile_overview: First Digital is a technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry.
profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. The team is behind Abacus rapid settlement network and provides APIs, settlement and clearing, accounting, compliance, fiat gateways, payments rails and open finance infrastructure for the industry.

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

profile_overview: First Digital is a technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry.
profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. The team is behind Abacus rapid settlement network and provides APIs, settlement and clearing, accounting, compliance, fiat gateways, payments rails and open finance infrastructure for the industry.

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.

profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. The team is behind Abacus rapid settlement network and provides APIs, settlement and clearing, accounting, compliance, fiat gateways, payments rails and open finance infrastructure for the industry.

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

In a riveting fireside chat with Raj Nandwani, Head of Global Business Development atBinance, we delved into the topic "Traditional Finance and the Intersection of the New Digital Assets Frontier." 

Our dialogue highlighted the transformative role of stablecoins like#FDUSDin succession planning and wealth protection within the Web 3 landscape, providing a secure method to manage and secure wealth in an increasingly digital-first economy.

Day 1 set a high bar with a panel discussion on "Unlocking Value and Stablecoin Adoption in Asia," where I had the honor of sharing the stage with thought leaders in the industry. Moderated byBinance's Global Head of Sanctions, we engaged in deep discussions alongsideLucy Gazmararian, Founder & Managing Partner ofToken Bay Capital, andSinan Kocç, CEO ofBiLira.

Together, we discussed how#stablecoinscan co-exist with central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) to power the financial infrastructure of Web 2.5 through to 3.0. The dialogue opened up perspectives on the power of consumer choice in the future of currency. 

The spotlight on stablecoins is brighter than ever, especially considering their expanding use cases, from streamlining payroll, payments, to banking the unbanked. It is also clear that the conversation around regulatory frameworks for stablecoins is just as crucial as their development and the need for a balanced approach that foster#innovationwhile ensuring security and#trustin the system.#FDUSD#BinanceBlockchainWeek#CBDC#FinancialInclusion#Regulation#Asia

Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

We are pleased to learn about the listing of $FDUSD byFlipster, another exchange that might be of interest to our community. $FDUSD is now being accepted as a deposit option onFlipsterso that users can now easily fund their Flipster wallets with our#stablecoin.#FDUSD, backed by First Digital's robust reserves, provides stability and security, making it an ideal choice for users looking for a reliable fiat-backed digital asset. 3,279 followers First Digital USD (FDUSD) is a new USD-pegged stablecoin byFirst Digital. Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.

profile_overview: First Digital is a technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry.
profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. The team is behind Abacus rapid settlement network and provides APIs, settlement and clearing, accounting, compliance, fiat gateways, payments rails and open finance infrastructure for the industry.

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Thank you once again toBinancefor having us participate in a well attended, and well organised conference. CEO at First Digital Trust Day 2 atBinanceBlockchain Week Istanbul!

Thrilled to take the stage to introduceFirst Digitaland our flagship#FDUSD- the largest#stablecoinin Asia, and developed out of#Hongkong.

In a riveting fireside chat with Raj Nandwani, Head of Global Business Development atBinance, we delved into the topic "Traditional Finance and the Intersection of the New Digital Assets Frontier." 

Our dialogue highlighted the transformative role of stablecoins like#FDUSDin succession planning and wealth protection within the Web 3 landscape, providing a secure method to manage and secure wealth in an increasingly digital-first economy.

With Hong Kong's drive to become a global#Web3hub, it's an exciting time for FDT to collaborate with regulators HKMA on pioneering FDUSD applications, ensuring transparent governance and meticulous product stewardship.

A heartfelt thank you toBinancefor the opportunity, and I eagerly anticipate our continued dialogue into 2024.#FDUSD#BinanceBlockchainWeek#DigitalAssets#Innovation#WealthProtection

What a successful first day of riveting discussions lead by our very own Vincent Chok on a topic that is not going away anytime soon,#stablecoins.

It was great to see Vincent take the stage at such a prestigious conference and with high calibre industry insiders such as Lucy and Sinan, who both shared a lot of interesting insights around stable digital currencies 👏 CEO at First Digital Trust Engaging Week atBinanceBlockchain Week in Istanbul!

Day 1 set a high bar with a panel discussion on "Unlocking Value and Stablecoin Adoption in Asia," where I had the honor of sharing the stage with thought leaders in the industry. Moderated byBinance's Global Head of Sanctions, we engaged in deep discussions alongsideLucy Gazmararian, Founder & Managing Partner ofToken Bay Capital, andSinan Kocç, CEO ofBiLira.

Together, we discussed how#stablecoinscan co-exist with central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) to power the financial infrastructure of Web 2.5 through to 3.0. The dialogue opened up perspectives on the power of consumer choice in the future of currency. 

The spotlight on stablecoins is brighter than ever, especially considering their expanding use cases, from streamlining payroll, payments, to banking the unbanked. Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Both cities have robust financial infrastructures, no capital controls and good public private partnership and these elements will help the#digitalassetmarket thrive.

Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX

profile_overview: First Digital is a technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry.
profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. First Digitalis pleased to announce that#FDUSDwill be integrated into theSui Foundationnetwork, becoming the ecosystem’s first native 1:1 stablecoin.

Marrying the innovation of DeFi with the trust and stability of First Digital's stablecoins, this partnership marks a significant milestone in the expansion of FDUSD into the thriving Sui DeFi ecosystem, with Sui becoming the first network FDUSD has expanded to since its inception.

The partnership between First Digital and Sui is a strategic alliance aimed at enhancing liquidity and efficiency of transactions, continuing to bridge traditional finance to the ever-expanding digital economy.

Sui will be the first chain FDUSD has expanded to since its inception in June 2023. 

FDUSD has a market cap of $3.4 billion, and has seen the fifth-highest trading volume across the industry, including $8 billion of volume in a single day.Vincent Chok, CEO atFirst Digital, will be onstage at#SuiBasecamptomorrow at 10:30 a.m. CET to share more details about this historic moment.

profile_overview: First Digital is a technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry.
profile_bio: First Digital Trust ("FDT") is Asia’s leading technology-driven financial institution powering the digital asset industry and servicing fintech innovators including blockchain startups, money service businesses and token issuers. The team is behind Abacus rapid settlement network and provides APIs, settlement and clearing, accounting, compliance, fiat gateways, payments rails and open finance infrastructure for the industry.

We are pleased to learn about the listing of $FDUSD byFlipster, another exchange that might be of interest to our community. $FDUSD is now being accepted as a deposit option onFlipsterso that users can now easily fund their Flipster wallets with our#stablecoin.#FDUSD, backed by First Digital's robust reserves, provides stability and security, making it an ideal choice for users looking for a reliable fiat-backed digital asset. 3,440 followers First Digital USD (FDUSD) is a new USD-pegged stablecoin byFirst Digital. Let’s learn more about $FDUSD.

1. Redeemable: Holders have the ability to redeem their#FDUSDtokens at a similar value for U.S. dollars, as FDUSD is backed by high-quality cash reserves and cash equivalents. This offers users peace of mind knowing their digital currency holds real and retrievable value.

2. Backed by quality assets: FDUSD is designed to maintain a stable price, which can appeal to those looking to deal with the volatility of the cryptocurrency market. FDUSD reserves are segregated from the custodian’s own funds, separating users' assets from any financial troubles of the custodian. Under the stewardship of First Digital Trust Limited, FDUSD reserves are more secure and protected, which contributes towards FDUSD’s stability.

3. Programmable: FDUSD’s programmability enables the execution of smart contracts, escrow services, and insurance arrangements without the need for intermediaries. This paves the way for users to have more control over their financial transactions, enhancing transactional efficiency and minimizing costs.

4. Low fees: The cost-efficiency of blockchain-based transactions reduces associated fees, a stark contrast to traditional financial systems. The lower cost of FDUSD transactions presents an alternative for users, enabling broader accessibility and financial inclusion. 

5. Operates on decentralized networks: FDUSD works on decentralized networks distributed across multiple nodes. This means no single point of failure can compromise the system, enhancing security, transparency, and resilience.

Thrilled to take the stage to introduceFirst Digitaland our flagship#FDUSD- the largest#stablecoinin Asia, and developed out of#Hongkong.

In a riveting fireside chat with Raj Nandwani, Head of Global Business Development atBinance, we delved into the topic "Traditional Finance and the Intersection of the New Digital Assets Frontier." 

Our dialogue highlighted the transformative role of stablecoins like#FDUSDin succession planning and wealth protection within the Web 3 landscape, providing a secure method to manage and secure wealth in an increasingly digital-first economy.

What a successful first day of riveting discussions lead by our very own Vincent Chok on a topic that is not going away anytime soon,#stablecoins.

It was great to see Vincent take the stage at such a prestigious conference and with high calibre industry insiders such as Lucy and Sinan, who both shared a lot of interesting insights around stable digital currencies 👏 CEO at First Digital Trust Engaging Week atBinanceBlockchain Week in Istanbul!

Day 1 set a high bar with a panel discussion on "Unlocking Value and Stablecoin Adoption in Asia," where I had the honor of sharing the stage with thought leaders in the industry. Moderated byBinance's Global Head of Sanctions, we engaged in deep discussions alongsideLucy Gazmararian, Founder & Managing Partner ofToken Bay Capital, andSinan Kocç, CEO ofBiLira.

Together, we discussed how#stablecoinscan co-exist with central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) to power the financial infrastructure of Web 2.5 through to 3.0. The dialogue opened up perspectives on the power of consumer choice in the future of currency. 

The spotlight on stablecoins is brighter than ever, especially considering their expanding use cases, from streamlining payroll, payments, to banking the unbanked. It is also clear that the conversation around regulatory frameworks for stablecoins is just as crucial as their development and the need for a balanced approach that foster#innovationwhile ensuring security and#trustin the system.#FDUSD#BinanceBlockchainWeek#CBDC#FinancialInclusion#Regulation#Asia

First Digitalreposted this CEO at First Digital Trust AtFirst Digital, we are keeping a close eye on the banking and#paymentsinfrastructure in Singapore so that we can better serve our clients.

We are currently in the process of applying for a payments license from the MAS in Singapore so that we can provide a full suite of services that complement our existing core#custodybusiness. We recognise that Singapore's banking#infrastructureis sophisticated and we want to be able to leverage that to solve some of the pain points our existing and potential clients are facing.

I truly believe that#Asiais primed for real growth and maturation of the industry. Hong Kong and Singapore are well positioned to capitalise on a huge opportunity to become the top Fintech/crypto hubs globally. Both cities have robust financial infrastructures, no capital controls and good public private partnership and these elements will help the#digitalassetmarket thrive.

Great to see our CEOVincent Chokthoughts and insights published in an Op Ed withForkast.Newson why Hong Kong is becoming the defacto#cryptohub globally 🌏 

It's an intresting must read!https://lnkd.in/gPeTqXwH#digitalassets#crypto#blockchaindevelopment#innovation CEO at First Digital Trust ThanksForkast.Newsfor featuring my thoughts on how#HongKongDollar notes offer a clue for the future of#digitalassets.  
 
Hong Kong is one of the few economies to have more than one private bank issue official banknotes, a testament to how the public-private partnership model can yield greater system credibility and penetration. Public-private partnerships is a familiar concept in Hong Kong in the delivery of public services and history has shown this model can also successfully in support the city’s world-class financial system. 
 
This is where we see clues as to how digital assets might be integrated into the city’s financial system in the near future – regulator HKMA has been urging banks to adopt a forward-looking approach and open bank accounts for licensed#VASPssince 1 June. 
 
Asia has taken a progressive stance toward digital assets and has recently doubled down on this. Today,#Singaporehas put clarity on#stablecoins, putting it amongst the first jurisdictions globally to agree to stablecoin#cryptoregulation. Whilst Hong Kong is also committed to introducing#regulationsfor stablecoin by 2024. 
 
I've said this in the past and I’ll reinforce the fact that I’m#bullishon Asia and strongly believe that we have the technological innovation and right mechanisms in place, it’s just a matter of time for the industry to flourish.
 
Read the article here:https://bit.ly/3DVHuSX
